## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots
(title = "Évolution temporelle de la donnée",
       x = "Date",
       y = "Valeur")
You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


```{r}
install.packages("car")
library(car)
```


```{r}
install.packages("ggplot2")

```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r}
# create data
X <- OS2$Années
Y <- OS2$Elec
data <- data.frame(X,Y)

# Plot
ggplot(data, aes(x=X, y=Y)) +
  geom_line()+
  geom_line(color = "blue", linetype = "solid", size = 1.2)+geom_point(color = "black", size = 2)+ 
  geom_text(aes(label = round(Y*100, 2)), vjust = -0.5, color = "black")+
  labs(title = "Évolution du taux d'accès à l'éléctricité",
       x = "Année",
       y = "Taux d'accès à l'éléctricité (en %)") + theme(
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0,5, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 10, face = "bold")) + theme_minimal() 
```
